issues.description: The solution implementation declares toString() with the wrong return type: it uses "public Object toString()" (solution) while the problem statement and Java's Object.toString() require a String return. The problem statement explicitly asks for a custom toString() method that returns a String (example shown). Declaring toString() to return Object is an incorrect signature that will not properly override java.lang.Object.toString() and will cause a compilation / overriding error. This is a structural bug in the solution repository that contradicts the specification and will confuse students (and prevent the code from compiling if used as reference).
